citations.narrative:
-The facility followed a puppy vaccine schedule that a buyer preferred for 3 litters in Sept and October. The schedule used
wasn't the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). The facility's animal caretaker then got an updated
vaccine schedule that is approved by the AV and has been following the approved schedule.
Not following a vaccine schedule that is approved by the AV might not protect animals from diseases. The facility must
ensure that vaccine schedules set by the attending veterinarian are followed at all times (for adults and puppies) and that
any changes to the schedule are approved by the AV.
***Maintain correct from this day forward.
-In October the facility started a de-worming schedule that was guided by the puppy buyer and hasn't been approved by
the attending veterinarian (AV). Using a de-worming schedule that isn't approved by the AV doesn't ensure adequate
parasite prevention is in place. Ensure to follow a schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites for puppies and adult
dogs that has been reviewed and approved by the attending veterinarian.
***Correct by November 17, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
-The facility followed a puppy vaccine schedule that a buyer preferred for 3 litters in Sept and October. The schedule used 
wasn't the schedule approved by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). The facility's animal caretaker then got an updated 
vaccine schedule that is approved by the AV and has been following the approved schedule. 
Not following a vaccine schedule that is approved by the AV might not protect animals from diseases. The facility must 
ensure that vaccine schedules set by the attending veterinarian are followed at all times (for adults and puppies) and that 
any changes to the schedule are approved by the AV.  
***Maintain correct from this day forward.  
 
-In October the facility started a de-worming schedule that was guided by the puppy buyer and hasn't been approved by 
the attending veterinarian (AV). Using a de-worming schedule that isn't approved by the AV doesn't ensure adequate 
parasite prevention is in place. Ensure to follow a schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites for puppies and adult 
dogs that has been reviewed and approved by the attending veterinarian.  
***Correct by November 17, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
